alternateTitles.japanese: ルフィの過去!赤髪のシャンクス登場
alternateTitles.romanized: Rufi no Kako! Akagami no Shankusu Tōjō
alternateTitles.funimation: Luffy's Past! The Red-haired Shanks Appears!

description: Luffy's treasured straw hat is revealed to be a gift from the legendary pirate Shanks. In a flashback, young Luffy meets Shanks in his hometown and accidentally eats a Devil Fruit. When Luffy is endangered by mountain bandits, Shanks saves him but loses his arm to a Sea King. In the present, Luffy arrives in Orange Town and encounters the thief Nami.
arcName: Romance Dawn Arc / Orange Town Arc

events.title: Shanks' First Appearance
events.description: Red-Haired Shanks appears for the first time in a flashback to Foosha Village 12 years ago, establishing himself as Luffy's childhood idol and the person who inspired his pirate journey.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most important characters in One Piece - the Yonko who gave Luffy his iconic straw hat and inspired his dream. This flashback establishes the foundation of Luffy's motivations.

quotes.text: You want to be a pirate, Luffy? But you can't even swim!
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks teasing young Luffy about wanting to join his crew

events.title: Makino's First Appearance
events.description: Makino, the kind bartender of Partys Bar in Foosha Village, appears serving Shanks and his crew while caring for young Luffy.
events.significance: Introduces a recurring character who represents Luffy's peaceful hometown life and serves as a maternal figure in his childhood.

events.title: Luffy Accidentally Eats the Gomu Gomu no Mi
events.description: Young Luffy unknowingly eats the Gomu Gomu no Mi Devil Fruit that Shanks had acquired, permanently gaining rubber powers but losing the ability to swim. This is revealed through flashback, explaining the origin of Luffy's abilities.
events.significance: The pivotal moment that gave Luffy his signature powers. This devil fruit consumption sets Luffy on his path and later reveals to be one of the most important fruits in the world (revealed much later as the Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Nika).

quotes.text: Luffy! Did you eat the Gomu Gomu fruit that was in that chest?!
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks realizes Luffy ate the Devil Fruit

quotes.speaker: Young Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's reaction after eating the fruit

events.title: Higuma and the Mountain Bandits Arrive
events.description: Higuma, a mountain bandit with a bounty of 8,000,000 berries, arrives at Partys Bar with his gang and demands sake, creating a confrontation with Shanks and his crew.
events.significance: Introduces the antagonist whose actions lead to Shanks losing his arm and giving Luffy the straw hat, making this encounter crucial to the series' foundation.

quotes.text: I'm Higuma the Bear! My head is worth 8 million berries!
quotes.speaker: Higuma

events.title: Shanks Refuses to Fight Higuma
events.description: Despite being insulted and having sake poured on his head, Shanks laughs it off and refuses to fight Higuma, showing his mature approach to conflict. Young Luffy is confused and disappointed by Shanks' pacifism.
events.significance: Demonstrates Shanks' character and wisdom - he doesn't fight over petty insults. This moment contrasts with Luffy's hot-headed nature and shows true strength doesn't require proving itself to everyone. It's a key character-defining moment for Shanks.

quotes.text: It's just sake. No need to get worked up over spilled drinks.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks' calm response to being humiliated

events.title: Luffy Defends Shanks and Gets Kidnapped
events.description: Angry at Shanks being humiliated, young Luffy stands up to Higuma and his bandits. When Higuma responds with violence, Luffy's friends are beaten and he is kidnapped by the mountain bandits.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's core personality trait of defending those he cares about, even when outmatched. This reckless bravery becomes his defining characteristic throughout the series.

quotes.text: Don't you dare make fun of Shanks!
quotes.speaker: Young Luffy

events.title: Lord of the Coast Devours Higuma
events.description: After Higuma throws Luffy into the ocean, the Lord of the Coast, a massive Sea King, emerges from the water and devours Higuma whole in one bite.
events.significance: Demonstrates the real danger of the seas and Sea Kings. This creature's appearance sets up the dramatic moment where Shanks loses his arm.

events.title: Shanks Loses His Arm Saving Luffy
events.description: Shanks arrives just in time to save Luffy from the Lord of the Coast, but sacrifices his left arm in the process. He loses his dominant arm to save the young boy who will become the future Pirate King.
events.significance: One of the most iconic and emotional moments in One Piece. Shanks' sacrifice demonstrates the value he places on Luffy's life and the new generation. This moment cements their bond and becomes Luffy's driving motivation. The missing arm becomes Shanks' defining visual characteristic.

quotes.text: I'm glad you're okay. I was worried.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks comforting Luffy after losing his arm

quotes.text: It's only an arm. I'm just glad you're safe.
quotes.speaker: Shanks

events.title: First Use of Haki in One Piece
events.description: Shanks uses Conqueror's Haki (Haoshoku Haki) to intimidate and scare away the Lord of the Coast without physically touching it. This is the very first instance of Haki shown in the entire series, though it's not explained or named at this point.
events.significance: The first appearance of Haki in One Piece, introducing a power system that won't be fully explained for hundreds of episodes. This moment gains massive significance in retrospect, proving Shanks possessed one of the rarest forms of Haki from the beginning. Only revealed to be Haki much later in the series.

events.title: Shanks Gives Luffy His Straw Hat
events.description: Before departing for the Grand Line, Shanks entrusts his treasured straw hat to young Luffy, making him promise to return it when he becomes a great pirate. Luffy vows to surpass Shanks and become King of the Pirates.
events.significance: The origin of Luffy's most iconic possession and the symbol of his promise with Shanks. The straw hat becomes the most recognizable image of One Piece and represents Luffy's dream, his bond with Shanks, and the legacy of inherited will. This moment is the emotional core of the entire series.

quotes.text: Take care of my hat for me. It's my most treasured possession. Promise you'll give it back when you've become a great pirate.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks entrusting his hat to Luffy

quotes.text: I will! I'm gonna become King of the Pirates! And then I'll give this hat back to you!
quotes.speaker: Young Luffy

events.title: Luffy and Zoro Arrive at Orange Town
events.description: In the present day, Luffy and Zoro arrive at Orange Town on a small boat, seeking supplies and information. The town appears deserted and damaged.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Orange Town arc and sets up the encounter with Buggy the Clown, Luffy's first major antagonist.

events.title: Nami's First Appearance
events.description: Nami appears for the first time, having just stolen treasure and a Grand Line map from Buggy the Clown's pirates. She is introduced as a skilled thief and navigator.
events.significance: First appearance of Nami, who will become the Straw Hat Pirates' navigator and one of the main characters of One Piece. This introduction establishes her as a clever thief and sets up her recruitment arc.

quotes.text: I'm a thief who specializes in stealing from pirates!
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Nami Meets Luffy and Zoro
events.description: Nami encounters Luffy and Zoro for the first time in Orange Town. She sizes them up as potential marks or threats, beginning their complex relationship.
events.significance: The first meeting between three future Straw Hat crew members. This encounter begins Nami's journey toward joining Luffy's crew.

quotes.text: Take care of my hat for me. It's my most treasured possession. Promise you'll give it back when you've become a great pirate.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Entrusting his straw hat to Luffy

quotes.text: I will! I'm gonna become King of the Pirates! And then I'll give this hat back to you!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: It's only an arm. I'm just glad you're safe.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: After losing his arm to save Luffy

themes.description: The episode explores the concept of inherited will through Shanks passing his straw hat to Luffy, symbolizing the passing of dreams and ambitions from one generation to the next.
themes.symbolism: The straw hat represents the dreams, will, and legacy that pirates pass down through generations.

themes.description: Shanks' willingness to sacrifice his arm for Luffy demonstrates the value he places on the next generation and his belief in Luffy's potential.
themes.symbolism: Shanks' missing arm becomes a permanent reminder of his faith in Luffy.

themes.description: Shanks refusing to fight Higuma over insults shows that true strength means knowing when not to fight, contrasting with fighting over every slight.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between Shanks' restraint and his decisive action when Luffy is threatened.

characterSpotlights.development: Shanks is revealed as the pivotal figure in Luffy's life who gave him his dream, his devil fruit powers (accidentally), and his iconic straw hat. His sacrifice and faith in Luffy sets the foundation for the entire series.
keyActions: Refuses to fight Higuma over petty insults
Saves Luffy from the Lord of the Coast
Loses his left arm protecting Luffy
Uses Conqueror's Haki for the first time in the series
Gives his straw hat to Luffy
quotes: It's only an arm. I'm just glad you're safe.

characterSpotlights.role: Young protagonist learning important life lessons
characterSpotlights.development: We see how Luffy gained his powers, his iconic hat, and his dream. The flashback shows his reckless bravery and loyalty even as a child.
keyActions: Accidentally eats the Gomu Gomu no Mi
Nearly drowns after being thrown in the ocean
Promises Shanks to become King of the Pirates

characterSpotlights.development: First appearance as a skilled thief who targets pirates. Establishes her cunning and resourcefulness.
keyActions: Steals treasure and Grand Line map from Buggy
quotes: I'm a thief who specializes in stealing from pirates!

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, Luffy finds the Devil Fruit in a chest and eats it out of hunger. The anime shows it more casually as Shanks had it stored with their supplies.
The 4Kids dub replaced all references to alcohol/sake with 'juice' and other non-alcoholic beverages, significantly altering the bar scenes.

trivia.fact: This episode contains the very first use of Haki in the entire One Piece series, though it isn't explained or named until hundreds of episodes later.
Shanks' sacrifice of his arm was suggested by editor Asada to make the scene more impactful. Oda has stated he didn't originally plan for Shanks to lose his arm.

sources.title: One Piece: The Reason Why Oda Cut Off Shanks Arm, Revealed

trivia.fact: Shūichi Ikeda, who voices Shanks in Japanese, is famous for voicing Char Aznable in Mobile Suit Gundam. His casting as Shanks gives the character a similar cool, mentor-like presence.
The Lord of the Coast (the Sea King that ate Higuma and took Shanks' arm) reappears much later in the series, showing how much stronger Luffy has become.
